item.title: Big pile of bedding/clothes dumped, 13th September
item.description:
A big pile of bedding/clothes has been dumped on the pavement by a post near the Rozberin shop and block of flats. It is on the edge of the pavement by the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Southgate, London

item.title: Best kebab litter, 13th September
item.description:

item.title: Litter bin over spilling. Not emptied for at least 4 days., 13th September
item.description:
On Wednesday morning my children and I did quite a large litter pick on the common outside the winns common playground. This was due to the bin being full with carrier bags being filled and left by the side. Only to be blown about/ interfered with by foxes. It is now Saturday afternoon and I have walked past. The bin is still full (even fuller) and the large bag of rubbish we collected from the common is now strewn about. I understand the lovely lady who used to litter pick/ sort the rubbish has retired. Is this the cause of the problem? Full bin not being reported? Happy to litter pick (although wish people would be more respectful of their area and take individual responsibility). But surely leaving bins unemptied is not going to encourage people to use them. Or rather they canâ€™t. I will litter pick again and take home as much rubbish as I can but hopefully this can be rectified

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakedale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
